types.name: ApiVersion
types.description:
A version of the API, as defined by [Shopify API versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).
Versions are commonly referred to by their handle (for example, `2021-10`).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is actively supported by Shopify. Supported API versions are guaranteed to be stable. Unsupported API versions include unstable, release candidate, and end-of-life versions that are marked as unsupported. For more information, refer to [Versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).

types.name: Boolean
types.description: Represents `true` or `false` values.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
Represents an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)-encoded date and time string.
For example, 3:50 pm on September 7, 2019 in the time zone of UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) is
represented as `"2019-09-07T15:50:00Z`".

types.name: DisplayableError
types.description: Represents an error in the input of a mutation.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The path to the input field that caused the error.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The error message.

types.name: ID
types.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.

Example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`

types.name: MutationRoot
types.description: The schema's entry point for all mutation operations.

fields.name: captureSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open capture session.

After the `captureSessionReject` mutation completes on a given capture session, any
`captureSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `captureSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `reason` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: captureSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open capture session.

After the `captureSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given capture session, any
`captureSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `captureSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed.

fields.name: paymentSessionPending
fields.description:
Change a payment session status to pending.

Upon receiving the response from the `PaymentSessionPending` mutation,
you must redirect the customer back to Shopify, using `redirectUrl` in `nextAction`.

Upon completion, pending payments must be finalized into either a successful or failed state using
the `paymentSessionResolve` or `paymentSessionReject` mutations.
Both `sale` and `authorization` payments can be marked as pending.

args.name: pendingExpiresAt
args.description: The date and time when the pending payment expires, recommended to be within 3 days.

args.name: reason
args.description: The reason the payment is pending.

fields.name: paymentSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open payment session.
After the `paymentSessionReject` mutation completes on a given payment session, any
`paymentSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `paymentSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: paymentSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open payment session.
After the `paymentSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given payment session, any
`paymentSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `paymentSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

args.name: authorizationExpiresAt
args.description: The date and time when an authorized payment session expires.

fields.name: paymentsAppConfigure
fields.description: Configures the partner-managed payments gateway to work on the merchant's store. For an example of how to use the `paymentsAppConfigure` mutation, refer to the [Onboard a merchant payments app](https://shopify.dev/apps/payments/getting-started/onboard-a-merchant-payments-apps) tutorial.

args.name: externalHandle
args.description: Handle used in the external system.

args.name: ready
args.description: The provider is ready to process merchant's payments.

fields.name: refundSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open refund session.
After the `refundSessionReject` mutation completes on a given refund session, any
`refundSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `refundSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: refundSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open refund session.
After the `refundSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given refund session, any
`refundSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `refundSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: voidSessionReject
fields.description:
Rejects an open void session.
After the `voidSessionReject` mutation completes on a given void session, any
`voidSessionResolve` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `voidSessionReject`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `RejectionReasonInput` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: voidSessionResolve
fields.description:
Resolves an open void session.
After the `voidSessionResolve` mutation completes on a given void session, any
`voidSessionReject` mutation attempts will fail. Subsequent `voidSessionResolve`
mutation attempts will succeed, but the `Details` argument will be ignored.

fields.name: status

types.description: The payload required to redirect the customer to the shop after payment is finalized.

fields.name: redirectUrl

types.description: The next action that is expected of the Partner after the payment is finalized.

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action expected by the partner.

fields.name: context
fields.description: The context required to perform an action.

types.description:
The possible values that can be used to describe the next
action that a Partner should do after a payment is finalized.

enumValues.name: REDIRECT
enumValues.description: Redirect the customer to the next checkout step.

types.name: String
types.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: URL
types.description:
Represents an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.

For example, `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"` is a valid URL. It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host
(`johns-apparel.myshopify.com`).

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.
